description: I've been using Libresprite to create the sprites in my game for a few months and i enjoy it a lot. It obviously doesn't have some of the freatures that it's paid counterpart (Aseprite) has but it's really good. I like the oldschool feel of it.
good free aseprite
I have definitely used other sprite apps or programs that cost money with less features. This program works very well!
summary: Works well for a free program!

description: I love this. it is fun for making cool drawings. the only problem is that i am having trouble turning off effects i just don't know how but i'll figure it out
The best sprite editor i used so far, lacks some features but nothing i couldn't handle.
I can save my sprite normal not any probleme

It is great, but to me this just looks like an aseprite rip-off (for which I had to pay like 15chf on mac)
So, I don't know if this is entirely legal, but that was some years ago

FYI this is completely legal. In 2016 Aseprite (The parent of this project) changed its license from GPL to a custom one. While with the new license the project was still open source, it could no longer be redistributed as a binary. You can still download its source code and compile it, but that (comparitively) takes a lot of time and the only other legal way of obtaining the software is by buying it. LibreSprite on the other hand is just the last version of Aseprite before its conversion to the new license.
summary: A great tool for creating pixel art

description:
LibreSprite was forked from Aseprite when the latter changed its license to a proprietary one. It is essentially an open-source continuation of Aseprite.

With that aside, LibreSprite is a great pixel art editor. The user interface is good, with a nice retro vibe to it, and it has every feature I ever needed. Although I'm not a professional artist nor a game developer, using LibreSprite is a near flawless experience to me.

My only complaint is that the interface does not scale well on HiDPI displays, so you end up with a very small font. It's fixable with a bit tweaking though.
It's a great tool for pixel art. I am not a professional artist but I do some pixel art here and there, sometimes for my game and it is best for that job.

Anyone who see this

anyone who know code and reading can you maintain the GPL 2 version of LibreSprite
works just like the real thing. perfect imo
if you used asesprite this should be good for you
it was easy to create pixel art images with this. I do wish there was a mirror tool or a circle tool. there might have been but i did not see it.

Simply the best pixel art editor, no tilemap support compared to the official release- And it is quite laggy on my HDPI display compared to the official release and makes it very hard to work on spritesheets past a certain size.
Thanks for this nice prog!
summary: A pearl between a bunch of trash

description: antes cuando usaba windows pirateaba el AsePrite pero ahora que estoy en linux y descubri esta alternativa ¡ME ENCANTO!
отличная утилита для пиксель-арта
Приложение в полной мере копирует функционал Aseprite, но одна часто возникающая проблема всё портит. Горячие клавиши часто перестают работать, что очень мешает.
Cool app for pixel art!
